snippet: Analysts say the company, which is the world’s top cellphone maker, must cut prices or push innovation as low-cost Chinese handsets threaten its dominance.
abstract: World's largest smartphone maker Samsung mulls difficult choices in face of declining profits, largely due to incursions by price-cutting Chinese competitors like Huawei and Xiaomi; company has said that it will continue to reinforce its premium brand reputation, but it may one day be forced to cut prices, shift that could reshape the entire smartphone market.
lead_paragraph: Analysts say the company, which is the world’s top cellphone maker, must cut prices or push innovation as low-cost Chinese handsets threaten its dominance.

headline.main: Samsung Considers Its Counterattack as Rivals Erode Cellphone Profit
headline.print_headline: Samsung Considers Its Counterattack as Rivals Erode Cellphone Profit
